turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Sacred Band (1821).
turn.1: What was the Sacred Band's main activity?
turn.2: For that reason they were also called "melanophoroi" or "mavrophoroi" ("Black-wearers").
turn.4: The Sacred Band uniform consisted of a long tunic, spatter dash and tall headgear, that according to Konstantinos Rados' description the headgear was similar to that of the Hussars.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The headgear had a white plume and a tricolor (red, white, cyan) national coat of arms.
turn.8: Under this (frontally) there was a skull with 2 crossed bones of white metal, which was meaning Freedom or Death.
turn.10: A Sacred Band's member had a spearman rifle and a leather belt for the "palaska" (cartridge belt).
turn.11: Did they have any other uniforms?
turn.12: The only known part of the Sacred Band's member's uniform is the one of Konstantinos Xenokratis (1803–1876), which is displayed in the National Historical Museum of Greece.
